comment.body: Zeronet's primary function is to provide a distributed website platform. So by default, yes, everything is public, but you can build on top of it. Zites like ZeroMail encrypt messages using PGP so that even though you can freely peruse the zite's files, you can't read the messages. It's just all gibberish unless you have a user's private key. At best you might be able to figure out that UserA sent a message to UserB, but nothing more.
I don't know about "neat"... ZeroHello can get a bit cluttered if you visit a few dozen zites...
@Krutonium: I was Half-joking, but I hope you enjoy your time here.
